stanford.androidlib

Class OnSwipeListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.androidlib.OnSwipeListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View.OnTouchListener

    public class OnSwipeListener
extends Object
implements View.OnTouchListener
    This class makes it easier to detect mouse/finger swipe motions on a view.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  OnSwipeListener.OnScaleListenerImpl
      This interface makes it easier to detect mouse/finger pinch-to-scale motions on a view.
      static class  OnSwipeListener.OnSwipeAdapterImpl
      This class makes it easier to detect mouse/finger swipe motions on a view.
      static interface  OnSwipeListener.OnSwipeListenerImpl
      This interface makes it easier to detect mouse/finger swipe motions on a view.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OnSwipeListener(Context context)
      Constructs a new listener for the given context (activity or fragment).

      Internal method used to implement mouse touch events.
      OnSwipeListener setAnimated(boolean anim)
      Sets whether the view should animate itself when it snaps back or slides off screen.
      OnSwipeListener setAnimationDelay(long ms)
      Sets the number of milliseconds long that each drag/snap animation will take.
      OnSwipeListener setDistanceThreshold(float px)
      Sets the number of pixels before the listener considers the user to have swiped.
      OnSwipeListener setDragHorizontal(boolean drag)
      Sets whether the view should track the user's finger as it is dragged horizontally.
      OnSwipeListener setDragSnapBack(boolean snap)
      Sets whether the view should snap back into position when the user stops dragging it.
      OnSwipeListener setDragSnapThreshold(float px)
      Sets the number of pixels in which the view will "snap back" if dragged.
      OnSwipeListener setDragVertical(boolean drag)
      Sets whether the view should track the user's finger as it is dragged vertically.
      OnSwipeListener setExitScreenOnSwipe(boolean exit)
      Sets whether the view should slide itself off the screen once it has been swiped.
      OnSwipeListener setVelocityThreshold(float px)
      Sets the rate of finger speed before the listener considers the user to have swiped.

      • onSwipeLeft

        public void onSwipeLeft(float distance)
        You can override this method if you want to subclass OnSwipeListener. Called when the user swipes the view to the left.

      • onSwipeRight

        You can override this method if you want to subclass OnSwipeListener. Called when the user swipes the view to the right.

      • onSwipeUp

        public void onSwipeUp(float distance)
        You can override this method if you want to subclass OnSwipeListener. Called when the user swipes the view upward.

      • onSwipeDown

        public void onSwipeDown(float distance)
        You can override this method if you want to subclass OnSwipeListener. Called when the user swipes the view downward.

      • onScale

        public void onScale(float factor)
        You can override this method if you want to subclass OnSwipeListener. Called when the user pinches to zoom.

      • onTouch

        public final boolean onTouch(View view,
                             MotionEvent event)
        Internal method used to implement mouse touch events. Not to be called directly by clients.
        Specified by:
        onTouch in interface View.OnTouchListener

      • setDistanceThreshold

        public OnSwipeListener setDistanceThreshold(float px)
        Sets the number of pixels before the listener considers the user to have swiped.

        Sets the rate of finger speed before the listener considers the user to have swiped.

      • setDragSnapThreshold

        public OnSwipeListener setDragSnapThreshold(float px)
        Sets the number of pixels in which the view will "snap back" if dragged.

      • setAnimationDelay

        public OnSwipeListener setAnimationDelay(long ms)
        Sets the number of milliseconds long that each drag/snap animation will take.

        Sets whether the view should slide itself off the screen once it has been swiped.

        public OnSwipeListener setDragHorizontal(boolean drag)
        Sets whether the view should track the user's finger as it is dragged horizontally.

      • setDragVertical

        public OnSwipeListener setDragVertical(boolean drag)
        Sets whether the view should track the user's finger as it is dragged vertically.

      • setDragSnapBack

        public OnSwipeListener setDragSnapBack(boolean snap)
        Sets whether the view should snap back into position when the user stops dragging it.

      • setAnimated

        public OnSwipeListener setAnimated(boolean anim)
        Sets whether the view should animate itself when it snaps back or slides off screen.
